abstract.p: South Korean Finance Ministry says Korea Investment Trust Co and Daehan Investment Trust Co will each get one trillion won (about $900 million) in June, as first part of 4.9 trillion won bailout (S)

block.p: Two of South Korea's largest investment trusts -- the Korea Investment Trust Company and the Daehan Investment Trust Company -- will each receive one trillion won (about $900 million) in June, as the first part of a 4.9 trillion won bailout, the Ministry of Finance and Economy said. The move is part of the South Korean government's latest round of changes in the financial sector aimed at the investment trusts, which are the nation's biggest buyers of corporate bonds. Their heavy exposure to bonds sold by the Daewoo Group and other deeply indebted conglomerates threatened the financial health of the investment trusts last year.
